metadata.title: CVE-2018-5133 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
If the "app.support.baseURL" preference is changed by a malicious localprogram to contain HTML and script content, this content is not sanitized.It will be executed if a user loads"chrome://browser/content/preferences/in-content/preferences.xul" directlyin a tab and executes a search. This stored preference is also executedwhenever an EME video player plugin displays a CDM-disabled message as anotification message. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
